summary: The Election Mail Act (HR 4915) aims to improve election mail procedures. Key provisions include requiring same-day processing for ballots by the Postal Service, mandating intelligent mail barcodes on return envelopes, requiring postmarks on ballots, enhancing ballot visibility, classifying election mail as first-class mail with free postage, restricting operational changes by the Postal Service near elections, mandating annual USPS consultations with Indian Tribes on voting access, and establishing a uniform deadline for ballot acceptance (7 days after the election if postmarked by election day).
